page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY HOSPITALLERS
page.content: Knights Hospitallers The Knights Hospitallers wore black cloaks with a white cross on the left breast and were also known as the order of St John of Jerusalem. They probably abandoned Godsfield at the time of the Black Death for their other Hampshire chapel at North Baddesley. In Early Mediaeval England pilgrims would be flocking to the shrine of St Swithun in Winchester. It was the custome and fashion to visite such shrines and pilgrims would boast of their pilgrimages by wearing little lead badges.
